<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Esipil](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1280)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Among the least of the sahkils, esipils delight in spreading fears and uncertainty among people who live with animals that could turn on them. They generally appear to their prey as some benign creature such as a domesticated dog or cat, but once they gain trust and get their victims close, they transform into a terrifying creature that looks part dog and part worm with tendrils of viscera that the creature uses as both a tongue and a weapon.

 Of all the sahkils, esipils are most likely to ingratiate themselves with mortals, sometimes serving powerful spellcasters and other times simply living among unsuspecting victims, biding their time until they strike.

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Esipil](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1280)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Tiny" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=70" />
<trait label="Sahkil" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=333" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 218</row>

**Perception** +7; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Requian](/Languages.aspx?ID=34); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) (touch)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +7, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +4

**Con** +2

**Int** +1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Easy to Call** A sahkil's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the [_planar binding_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=17) ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +7 

**Ref** +9 

**Will** +5 

</row>

**HP** 16

**Immunities**
[fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68)

**Weaknesses**
good 2

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +9 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d8 slashing plus 1d4 evil and Grab

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d6 slashing plus 1d4 evil

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 15
- **Cantrips (1st)**
[Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177)
- **1st**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110) (at will)
- **2nd**
[Mirror Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=197)
- **3rd**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The esipil transforms into a Tiny cat, dog, or other unassuming domestic animal. This doesn't affect the esipil's statistics, but it could change the damage type of its Strikes.

**Skip Between** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) The sahkil moves from the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) to the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9) or vice-versa, with the effects of [_ethereal jaunt_](/Spells.aspx?ID=105) except that the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

</column>
